findings.title: ST - Stop Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner by setting `tokenLock` to true and whitelisting himself or by setting `isLimited` to true and `transacLimit` to zero.

findings.title: MT - Mint Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens and may take advantage of it by calling the `mint` function, resulting in highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: BC - Blacklisted Contracts
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop contracts from transactions and may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklistMalicious` function.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: There are code segments that are repetitive in the contract. Those segments increase the code size of the contract unnecessarily.

findings.title: L01 - Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L06 - Missing Events Access Control
findings.description: Detected missing events for critical access control parameters. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Detected missing events for critical arithmetic parameters. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code elimination is necessary to remove unreachable or redundant code.

findings.title: L11 - Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: The comparison to boolean constants is redundant. Boolean constants can be used directly and do not need to be compared to true or false.
